sen.j: 湯揚げ（ゆあげ）は、水揚げの方法の一つ。
sen.e: Yuage is one of the Mizuage (method to prolong the life of flowers) methods in Japanese flower arrangement.

sen.j: 生け花や、生花を扱う業種で、切花が長持ちするようにする処理方法の一つで、菊科植物に向く。
sen.e: It refers to one of the treatment methods to prolong cut flowers in Japanese flower arrangement or in fresh flower business, which is suitable for chrysanthemums.
It refers to one of the treatments for prolonging the cut flowers in Japanese flower arrangement or in fresh flower business, which is suitable for chrysanthemums.

tit.j: 水揚げの技法としての湯揚げ

sen.j: 茎に気泡が入り、水が上がりにくくなった植物が水を吸いやすくするようにする時に使う方法。
sen.e: It is a method to use to help a plant absorb water when it has air bubbles in the stem and hardly absorbs water.
It is a method of helping a plant absorb water when it has air bubbles in the stem and hardly absorbs water.
sen.cmt: method to～の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: It is a method of helping a plant absorb water when it has air bubbles in the stem and hardly absorbs water.

sen.j: 新聞紙等で植物を包み、水蒸気があたらないようにし、80℃以上の熱湯に切り口を浸した後、1分ほど煮る。
sen.e: The plant is covered by newspaper not to be steamed, and its cut end is soaked in hot water at over 80 degrees, then boiled for about one minute.
The plant is covered by newspaper not to touch steam directly and its cut end is soaked in hot water at 80 degrees or over, then boiled for about one minute.
sen.cmt: be steamed～、at over～の部分を修正。
sen.e: The plant is covered by newspaper not to touch steam directly and its cut end is soaked in hot water at 80 degrees or over, then boiled for about one minute.

sen.j: 湯揚げをしたら、すぐに冷水に浸して冷ます。
sen.e: After being taken out of the hot water, it is immediately cooled down in cold water.
After took out of the hot water, immediately cool down in cold water.
sen.cmt: being, it isを除きました。
sen.e: After took out of the hot water, immediately cool down in cold water.

sen.j: 茎の中の水の体積を膨張させ、内部の気泡を植物の体外に押し出すことで水揚げがよくなる。
sen.e: The plant absorbs water better because the volume of the water in the stem expands and the inner air bubbles are pushed out of the plant.
sen.cmt: ここでの「水揚げ」は、水を吸い上げることと判断し訳出しました。
sen.e: The plant absorbs water better because the volume of the water in the stem expands and the inner air bubbles are pushed out of the plant.
